channel.title: Playing XBox on Laptop
channel.description:
Dont suggest pc games, comp cant handle it and not going to spend money on a laptop i don't need.
Well for one, if you're playing XBox on the monitor of your laptop can you use fraps to film?
In some of the results i have seen some say it can cause lag. But if your screen was being used as a TV i don't see how that would effect lag as the xbox is computing and your just displaying like watching a movie =\

item.title: Playing XBox on Laptop
item.dc:creator: @haticks haticks
item.description:
@haticks wrote:

[quote=“Davidude, post:12, topic:295429”][quote author=haticks link=topic=391434.msg2915579#msg2915579 date=1250384490]
VGA cable. I got one a week ago, and it works like a charm. And no, you can’t record it afaik.
[/quote]
Laptop monitors dont have a vga in, they only sometimes have a vga out…[/quote]o. i see.

Read full topic

item.title: Playing XBox on Laptop
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

haticks:

VGA cable. I got one a week ago, and it works like a charm. And no, you can’t record it afaik.

Laptop monitors dont have a vga in, they only sometimes have a vga out…

item.title: Playing XBox on Laptop
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Ok well i got an s video cable and attached it to my laptop and my tv… I can get my laptop screen to extends to the tv but i cant get the xbox screen to go onto my laptop screen. =\

Read full topic

item.title: Playing XBox on Laptop
item.dc:creator: @Man_UTD_Freak Man UTD Freak
item.description:
@Man_UTD_Freak wrote:

Frell:

From what i’ve read a vga cable should do the trick for displaying.

Would a HDMI cable do the same?

Read full topic

item.title: Playing XBox on Laptop
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

Change the recording type. I had to do that when I set up a friends.

Read full topic

item.title: Playing XBox on Laptop
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

0o i found a Dazzle* which plugs in via usb into the computer. I just cant get it to display whats coming through it.

Read full topic

item.title: Playing XBox on Laptop
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

The OS itself wouldn’t be able to recognise the xboxs signals and be able to record them. Although saying that I do remember plugging my xbox into my PC and watching it on the media center part of it. It was pretty laggy though and you couldn’t record or screenshot it because it was like a direct feed or something.

Just get a cap card.

Read full topic

item.title: Playing XBox on Laptop
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Thug-life:

You’re just using the laptops monitor, it isn’t running through the OS. So no, you couldn’t do that.

Hmm, would you know of any ways that could work? The laptop would be running just on a different input i think.

From what i’ve read a vga cable should do the trick for displaying.

Read full topic

item.title: Playing XBox on Laptop
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

You’re just using the laptops monitor, it isn’t running through the OS. So no, you couldn’t do that.

Read full topic

item.title: Playing XBox on Laptop
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

Get an EzCap, records NTSC, PAL-50 and PAL-60 in full colour, high quality and no lag. Get output splitters and you can watch your xboxon your tv and pc at the same time. Only costs like 15 pound.

Oh yeh and it doesn’t record to disc like some shit things out there, it’s all straight to hard drive.

Read full topic

item.title: Playing XBox on Laptop
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

fraps doesnt interface with your monitor
